etymologies: modern Latin, via Latin from Greek iris ‘rainbow, iris’

definitions: a flat, colored, ring-shaped membrane behind the cornea of the eye, with an adjustable circular opening (pupil) in the center.
an adjustable diaphragm of thin overlapping plates for regulating the size of a central hole, especially for the admission of light to a lens.
shortDefinitions: diaphragm for regulating size of central hole

definitions: a plant with sword-shaped leaves and showy flowers, typically purple, yellow, or white. Native to both Eurasia and North America, it is widely cultivated as an ornamental.

notes.text: Genus Iris, family Iridaceae (the iris family): many species and numerous hybrids, including the crested dwarf iris (I. cristata) and the sweet iris (I. pallida). The iris family also includes the gladioli, crocuses, and freesias
no object, with adverbial of direction

definitions: (of an aperture, typically that of a lens) open or close in the manner of an iris or iris diaphragm.
